title: Google\Cloud\Firestore\CollectionReference
name: CollectionReference
description:
Represents a Cloud Firestore Collection.

Collections are implicit namespaces for Firestore Documents. They are created when the first document is inserted, and cease to exist when the last document is removed.

Extends Google\Cloud\Firestore\Query

methods.name: name
methods.description:
Get the collection name.

Names are absolute. The result of this call would be of the form projects/<project-id>/databases/<database-id>/documents/<relative-path>.

Other methods are available to retrieve different parts of a collection name:

  • Google\Cloud\Firestore\CollectionReference::id() Returns the last element.
  • Google\Cloud\Firestore\CollectionReference::path() Returns the path, relative to the database.

methods.name: path
methods.description:
Get the collection path.

Paths identify the location of a collection, relative to the database name.

To retrieve the collection ID (the last element of the path), use Google\Cloud\Firestore\CollectionReference::id().

methods.name: id
methods.description:
Get the collection ID.

IDs are the path element which identifies a resource. To retrieve the full path to a resource (the resource name), use Google\Cloud\Firestore\CollectionReference::name().

methods.name: document
methods.description: Get a reference to a document which is a direct child of this collection.

methods.name: newDocument
methods.description:
Get a document reference with a randomly generated document ID.

This method does NOT insert the document until you call Google\Cloud\Firestore\DocumentReference::create().

methods.name: add
methods.description:
Generate a new document reference, and insert it with the given field data.

This method immediately inserts the document. If you wish for lazy creation of a Document instance, refer to Google\Cloud\Firestore\CollectionReference::document() or Google\Cloud\Firestore\CollectionReference::newDocument().

params.name: fields
params.description: An array containing field names paired with their value. Accepts a nested array, or a simple array of field paths.

methods.name: documents
methods.description:
Get all documents matching the provided query filters.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\Firestore\Query

params.name: options.maxRetries
params.description: The maximum number of times to retry a query. Defaults to 5.

methods.name: select
methods.description:
Add a SELECT to the Query.

Creates and returns a new Query instance that applies a field mask to the result and returns only the specified subset of fields. You can specify a list of field paths to return, or use an empty list to only return the references of matching documents.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\Firestore\Query

params.name: fieldPaths
params.description: The projection to return, in the form of an array of field paths. To only return the name of the document, provide an empty array.

returns.description: A new instance of Query with the given changes applied.

methods.description:
The maximum number of results to return.

Applies after all other constraints. Must be >= 0 if specified.

Applies before limit, but after all other constraints. Must be >= 0 if specified.

methods.name: startAt
methods.description:
A starting point for the query results.

Starts results at the provided set of field values relative to the order of the query. The order of the provided values must match the order of the order by clauses of the query. Values in the given cursor will be included in the result set, if found.

Multiple invocations of this call overwrite previous calls. Calling startAt() will overwrite both previous startAt() and startAfter() calls.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\Firestore\Query

params.name: fieldValues
params.description: A list of values defining the query starting point.

returns.description: A new instance of Query with the given changes applied.

methods.name: startAfter
methods.description:
A starting point for the query results.

Starts results after the provided set of field values relative to the order of the query. The order of the provided values must match the order of the order by clauses of the query. Values in the given cursor will not be included in the result set.

Multiple invocations of this call overwrite previous calls. Calling startAt() will overwrite both previous startAt() and startAfter() calls.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\Firestore\Query

params.name: fieldValues
params.description: A list of values defining the query starting point.

returns.description: A new instance of Query with the given changes applied.

methods.name: endBefore
methods.description:

Ends results before the provided set of field values relative to the order of the query. The order of the provided values must match the order of the order by clauses of the query. Values in the given cursor will be included in the result set, if found.

Multiple invocations of this call overwrite previous calls. Calling endBefore() will overwrite both previous endBefore() and endAt() calls.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\Firestore\Query
